duties_responsibilities.duty: Perform advanced PeopleSoft systems analysis and programming duties in the area of PeopleSoft Benefits and Pension Administration.
Provide technical assistance to programming personnel and assist in defining project feasibility and estimates.
Write, test, and debug complex PeopleSoft programs, including SQR, Application Engine, PeopleCode, etc.
Design and develop complex PeopleSoft Pages and Components, including XML Publisher reporting and integrating web services.
Prepare detailed technical design documents for existing and proposed PeopleSoft applications and provide technical solutions to enhance business processing efficiency.
Attend design review meetings, document meeting minutes, and demonstrate developed functionality to agency staff.
Comply with all applicable agency policies and procedures, including safety and standards of conduct.

education_certification.credential: Graduation from a four-year college or university with major coursework in data processing, computer science, or a related field.
6+ years experience with PeopleSoft PeopleTools development, 3+ years with PeopleSoft Benefits Administration and Pension Administration, and 3+ years using SQL with an Oracle database.
